headline.print_headline: Old-Line Hollywood Takes Back The Night

docs.snippet: Sunday night's telecast of the 79th annual Academy Awards on ABC posted some modest gains in ratings and audience totals over last year's numbers, though the special continued to lag well behind the highest-rated editions of the ceremony.     This...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sunday night's telecast of the 79th annual Academy Awards on ABC posted some modest gains in ratings and audience totals over last year's numbers, though the special continued to lag well behind the highest-rated editions of the ceremony. This year's show, which featured Ellen DeGeneres as its host and ''The Departed'' as the year's best movie, attracted an average audience of 39.9 million viewers, according to Nielsen, up one million from the 38.9 million who watched last year's show. This year's edition started a half-hour later, however, eliminating the lowest-rated 30 minutes of last year's telecast.
docs.abstract: Telecast of 79th annual Academy Awards on ABC posts modest gains in ratings and audience totals over last year's numbers; attracted average audience of 39.9 million viewers; numbers are still well below totals for two years ago, when show drew 42.1 million viewers, and decade ago when it drew 55.3 million (M)

headline.main: Viewer Numbers Increase a Bit For Oscars Show

docs.snippet: After seven snubs, Martin Scorsese finally won an Oscar. But did he win for the right movie?...
docs.lead_paragraph: After seven snubs, Martin Scorsese finally won an Oscar. But did he win for the right movie?
docs.abstract: After seven snubs, Martin Scorsese finally won an Oscar. But did he win for the right movie?

docs.snippet: James Cameron & company claim to have found Jesus's tomb -- and the bones of his family, including his wife, shaking the foundations of the Christian faith.......
docs.lead_paragraph: With no film in the running this year, director James Cameron might muffle some post-Oscar rhapsodizing as he looses the publicity hounds on his latest project, which strikes at the foundations of Christianity and already has Church authorities upset.
docs.abstract: James Cameron & company claim to have found Jesus's tomb -- and the bones of his family, including his wife, shaking the foundations of the Christian faith....

docs.snippet: A night to remember for Marty Scorsese, and time, finally, for the Bagger to put away the asbestos tux....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seeing Michael Arndt standing outside the Vanity Fair party at 2:00 a.m. with his Oscar in his hand for writing a screenplay that nobody liked for a movie that nobody wanted to make made the Bagger feel a little soft and mushy about the little golden guy.
docs.abstract: A night to remember for Marty Scorsese, and time, finally, for the Bagger to put away the asbestos tux.

docs.snippet: Melissa Etheridge on being gay and old-fashioned....
docs.lead_paragraph: Melissa Etheridge, whose "I Need to Wake Up," from "An Inconvenient Truth," came out of nowhere to win for best song, held up the Oscar in the press room and said, "This is the only naked man who will ever be in my bedroom."
docs.abstract: Melissa Etheridge on being gay and old-fashioned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Al Gore didn't have to worry about chads this time and arrived in the press room with an Oscar in hand for "An Inconvenient Truth."
